intro: Fumaria vaillantii var. chavinii, commonly known as the Chavin's celandine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in temperate, moist environments. It is often found in rocky or forested areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
